page.title: 11RAILWAY STATIONS,HARROW.
page.content: {Headstone Lane Station}was opened in 1913 for the London North Western Railway. Service was provided by British Railways Midland Region in 1948 when all the railways were nationalized and now links Euston, in London, to the Midlands and Scotland. The main line is electrified and through trains are powered by overhead electric wires. It is mainly used as a London commuter service station for local people. There is no car park. Built in 1911,{Hatch End Station}is an attractive red-brick building. When the station first opened, only two trains per day stopped: today, 171 local passenger, non-stopping passenger and goods trains go through the station between 9.00am and 3.30pm. It is mostly used by business men and shoppers going to London and by college students.
